employment.summary: After a first intern in an IT service company, I was hired by CANAL+, the french pay-tv channel leader. I work since there in an R&D team in charge of think about new ways to use TV services, and to prototype it.

history.summary: I was hired as a junior project manager but I quickly added more technical tasks to my skills to help solve projects issues. I worked on several project, usually for french government departments or public organizations, using Java/J2EE technologies, with a Java Framework developped by the company.
I worked in a 5-person team composed by a mix of skills (designer, developer, etc.) allowing us to fastly develop prototypes of new ways to watch TV
highlights: An iPad application to replace the paper edition of the monthly customers magazine
A set-top-box interactive application, developped in HTML and javascript, to the located weather informations, for the french TV channel 'La chaîne Météo'
A Facebook integration on set-top-box to share favourites programs
An iPad, web, and set-top-box application to enhance soccer games experience
A tool to survey CANAL+ activity on social networks

history.summary: I work in a 5-person team composed by a mix of skills (designer, developer, etc.) allowing us to fastly develop prototypes of new ways to watch TV
highlights: Rework of our set-top-box stack to use web technologies inside our set-top-boxes
An REST API, developped in Python, in a embedded real-time environment on our STB.

service.summary: Volunteer as computer teacher in senegalese school

education.summary: After my bachelor, I studied two years in **classes prépartoires** before graduate Telecom ParisTech, the first french school in telecommunications and informatic, and one of top-ten french engineering school.
